column4: After an update, my wifi doesn't work with WPA any more.  How can I diagnose WPA or figure out what the update did and undo it?
I had this issue: Try sudo apt-get install linux-backports-modules-karmic-generic
oh, I guess I have to connect to a network... heh
I don't know, it's a brand new Dell A90n, Ubuntu 8.04
so you are not updated to karmic yet
I guess Dell stays with LTS release, which would be fine with me if it works :)
Yeah... upgrade to the latest client
and it will probz fix any problem you are having
ooor go search the forum there may have been a patch
you should be able to do it via the update manager
just change your settings from long term release to nromal
Software sources doesn't seem to list that option.  Tabs are Updates, Third-Party Software, and Authentication
you have a query from me
